title: Railroad at Night
credit_line: Bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Charles E. Burchfield [1893-1967], West Seneca, NY; Montross Gallery, New York, NY [1]; Mr. [1886-1956] and Mrs. Frank K. M. Rehn, New York, NY [2]; Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., New York, NY until November 1946; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, November 18, 1946 until February 14, 1987 [3]; Mrs. James H. Beal, Pittsburgh, PA, until April 23, 1993; bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1994.

Notes:
[1]. See "The Beal Collection of American Art," Carnegie Museum of Art, 1994, pages 75-76.
[2]. According to a hand-written note by Mrs. Beal in curatorial file, this watercolor was "One of the earliest Burchfields that Mr. and Mrs. Frank K. M. Rehn owned."
[3]. Mrs. Beal purchased the watercolor for $400 from the Rehn Gallery in November 1946 (see curatorial file for her original notes, and copies of correspondence with the gallery, including receipt for the purchase, dated November 18, 1946, from Archives of American Art.)

creator.death_place: West Seneca (Erie county, New York state, United States)
